text: As I mentioned last time, night is a much bigger thing in Enshrouded since the Thralls of Twilight update landed, and night sanctums are one of the items on the list to check out. Welcome to Enshrouded Night sanctums (as they are called on the Wiki now, but they were  called night temples in the patch notes) were part of the upgrades to the night aspect of the game with the hook being: Can only be entered at night: their doors remain sealed during the day. Feature all-new architectural elements and are filled with dangerous traps. Offer exclusive rewards for those who dare to brave their depths. I had found a couple of them in our game, during the day. We’ll get to night temples at some point What I didn’t know was that there are 25 of these scattered around the map.  Finding two wasn’t a real achievement.  I need to do some more exploring. Also, I had yet to enter one of them yet.  In part that was to save new content for when the group was on together, but also because entry costs one spark, and while there are quite a few out there to be collected, they seem to be a limited resource and we also need them to upgrade the flame.  So I did not want to use them willy nilly. This past weekend we didn’t have the full group on, but Potshot and I were on so we decided to go check one out in the Nomad Highlands that happened to be a quick flight from the spire.  So when night arrived we headed out, glided in, spent our spark and the door opened up for us. A night sanctum revealed Inside the whole thing was… well… a bit small.  These are not Hollow Halls sized bites of content, or even as big as some of the sun temples.  They do, however, introduce a new hazard; spiked rolling pins of death.  The place had them all over, going up and down or running along tracks, sticking up vertically. That thing will grind you down As with past hazards, like the spark throwers and flaming ball generators, these will inflict some serious damage if you are not careful.  I managed to mis-time a set of them and ended up dead. Done in by the rolling pins of death Those were the primary hazard.  There were also a few mobs and some of the other hazards. The old school spark throwers The layout of the one we investigated was nice… but as noted, a bit limited in size.  I guess if you’re going to make 25 of these you can’t spend too much time on each one… assuming that they’re all different.  We may have to do a second one to find out. In the end there were a couple of chests which included some decent items and a special cosmetic item. A nice chest, but still just a chest A number of them have such an item according to the wiki.  We ended up with the Scholar Of The Empyrean Boots.  Go us.  Just four more sanctums in that biome and we will have collected the set. Overall, a nice little distraction, but not something that took us more that ten minutes to really exhaust.  Maybe fifteen minutes if we include the bit where Potshot tried to revive me on the death track and kept getting interrupted, then finally timed it right only for me to get killed by the passing rolling pin of death seconds later. We’ll have to get onto exploring to find some more… though I do want to see if harvesting sparks is a once per location thing… in which case there is a fixed number you can acquire… or if they “respawn” or are otherwise available beyond the count of flame shrines.
html:
As I mentioned last time, night is a much bigger thing in Enshrouded since the Thralls of Twilight update landed, and night sanctums are one of the items on the list to check out.

Welcome to Enshrouded

Night sanctums (as they are called on the Wiki now, but they were  called night temples in the patch notes) were part of the upgrades to the night aspect of the game with the hook being:

  • Can only be entered at night: their doors remain sealed during the day.
  • Feature all-new architectural elements and are filled with dangerous traps.
  • Offer exclusive rewards for those who dare to brave their depths.

I had found a couple of them in our game, during the day.

We’ll get to night temples at some point

What I didn’t know was that there are 25 of these scattered around the map.  Finding two wasn’t a real achievement.  I need to do some more exploring.

Also, I had yet to enter one of them yet.  In part that was to save new content for when the group was on together, but also because entry costs one spark, and while there are quite a few out there to be collected, they seem to be a limited resource and we also need them to upgrade the flame.  So I did not want to use them willy nilly.

This past weekend we didn’t have the full group on, but Potshot and I were on so we decided to go check one out in the Nomad Highlands that happened to be a quick flight from the spire.  So when night arrived we headed out, glided in, spent our spark and the door opened up for us.

A night sanctum revealed

Inside the whole thing was… well… a bit small.  These are not Hollow Halls sized bites of content, or even as big as some of the sun temples.  They do, however, introduce a new hazard; spiked rolling pins of death.  The place had them all over, going up and down or running along tracks, sticking up vertically.

That thing will grind you down

As with past hazards, like the spark throwers and flaming ball generators, these will inflict some serious damage if you are not careful.  I managed to mis-time a set of them and ended up dead.

Done in by the rolling pins of death

Those were the primary hazard.  There were also a few mobs and some of the other hazards.

The old school spark throwers

The layout of the one we investigated was nice… but as noted, a bit limited in size.  I guess if you’re going to make 25 of these you can’t spend too much time on each one… assuming that they’re all different.  We may have to do a second one to find out.

In the end there were a couple of chests which included some decent items and a special cosmetic item.

A nice chest, but still just a chest

A number of them have such an item according to the wiki.  We ended up with the Scholar Of The Empyrean Boots.  Go us.  Just four more sanctums in that biome and we will have collected the set.

Overall, a nice little distraction, but not something that took us more that ten minutes to really exhaust.  Maybe fifteen minutes if we include the bit where Potshot tried to revive me on the death track and kept getting interrupted, then finally timed it right only for me to get killed by the passing rolling pin of death seconds later.

We’ll have to get onto exploring to find some more… though I do want to see if harvesting sparks is a once per location thing… in which case there is a fixed number you can acquire… or if they “respawn” or are otherwise available beyond the count of flame shrines.
